2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.1: Then all the tribes of Israel came to David in Hebron, saying: Behold we are thy bone and thy flesh.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.2: Moreover yesterday also and the day before, when Saul was king over us, thou wast he that did lead out and bring in Israel: and the Lord said to thee: Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be prince over Israel.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.3: The ancients also of Israel came to the king to Hebron, and king David made a league with them in Hebron before the Lord: and they anointed David to be king over Israel.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.4: David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.5: In Hebron he reigned over Juda seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned three and thirty years over all Israel and Juda.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.6: And the king and all the men that were with him went to Jerusalem to the Jebusites the inhabitants of the land: and they said to David: Thou shalt not come in hither unless thou take away the blind and the lame that say: David shall not come in hither.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.7: But David took the castle of Sion, the same is the city of David.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.8: For David had offered that day a reward to whosoever should strike the Jebusites and get up to the gutters of the tops of the houses, and take away the blind and the lame that hated the soul of David: therefore it is said in the proverb: The blind and the lame shall not come into the temple.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.9: And David dwelt in the castle, and called it, The city of David: and built round about from Mello and inwards.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.10: And he went on prospering and growing up, and the Lord God of hosts was with him.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.11: And Hiram the king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and masons for walls: and they built a house for David.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.12: And David knew that the Lord bad confirmed him king over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom over his people Israel.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.13: And<u>David took more concubines and wives of Jerusalem</u>, after he was come from Hebron: and there were born to David other sons also and daughters:
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.14: And these are the names of them, that were born to him in Jerusalem, Samua, and Sobab, and Nathan, and Solomon,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.15: And Jebahar, and Elisua, and Nepheg,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.16: And Japhia, and Elisama, and Elioda, and Eliphaleth.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.17: And the Philistines heard that they had anointed David to be king over Israel: and they all came to seek David: and when David heard of it, he went down to a strong hold.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.18: And the Philistines coming spread themselves in the valley of Raphaim.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.19: And David consulted the Lord, saying: Shall I go up to the Philistines? and wilt thou deliver them into my hand? And the Lord said to David: Go up, for I will surely deliver the Philistines into thy hand.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.20: And David came to Baal Pharisim: and defeated them there, and he said: The Lord hath divided my enemies before me, as waters are divided. Therefore the name of the place was called Baal Pharisim.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.21: And they left there their idols: which David and his men took away.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.22: And the Philistines came up again and spread themselves in the valley of Raphaim.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.23: And David consulted the Lord: Shall I go up against the Philistines, and wilt thou deliver them into my hands? He answered: Go not up against them, but fetch a compass behind them, and thou shalt come upon them over against the pear trees.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.24: And when thou shalt hear the sound of one going in the tops of the pear trees, then shalt thou join battle: for then will the Lord go out before thy face to strike the army of the Philistines.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__05.25: And David did as the Lord had commanded him, and he smote the Philistines from Gabaa until thou come to Gezer.
